function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Use of fuzzy cognitive maps (FCM) could lead to inaccurate representation of causal reasoning for engineering resilience factors.","Impact":"Misinterpretation of causality could result in ineffective resilience strategies.","Mitigation":"Validation and verification of FCM with real-world data and expert input.","Technologies":"FCM validation algorithms and expert systems.","People":"Resilience researchers, decision-makers, engineers.","Owner":"Resilience researchers, engineers, experts."},{"Description":"Inaccurate assessment of infrastructure resilience through fuzzy architecture could lead to flawed decision-making.","Impact":"Poorly-informed decisions may compromise the resilience of critical infrastructure.","Mitigation":"Validation of fuzzy architecture with real-world case studies and expert knowledge.","Technologies":"Fuzzy architecture validation tools, expert systems.","People":"Infrastructure planners, decision-makers, engineers.","Owner":"Infrastructure planners, engineers, experts."},{"Description":"Qualitative assessments of organizational resilience factors may overlook critical quantitative indicators, leading to biased ranking.","Impact":"Misranking of resilience factors may result in misallocated resources and ineffective resilience planning.","Mitigation":"Integration of quantitative data into the evaluation process, validation with real-world performance metrics.","Technologies":"Resilience assessment tools, data analytics platforms.","People":"Organizational leaders, resilience planners, analysts.","Owner":"Organizational leaders, analysts, experts."}]}
